title: Selena Gomez new album "for you" font
content:
I really like the "G", please help. Thank you

Solved By: 

 [Ryuk](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/typophile.com/user/22675 "View user profile.")

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [SELENA GOMEZ - FOR YOU.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/typophile.com/files/SELENA%20GOMEZ%20-%20FOR%20YOU.jpg) | 47.84 KB |
author: notjetimisela

comments.content:
Closest I could find is Friandise (which would require some artificial condensing and editing to achieve the stencil effect, as well as customizing the |G|):

[http://www.dafont.com/search.php?q=Friandise&text=SELENAGOMEZ](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/www.dafont.com/search.php?q=Friandise&text=SELENAGOMEZ "http://www.dafont.com/search.php?q=Friandise&text=SELENAGOMEZ")

No match either but don't think it could me something else than a customization. Reminds me of this unidentified [high contrasted sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/typophile.com/node/114140) from New York Magazine.  
Best ready-to go options for me (meaning stencil contrasted sans): [Vanitas Stencil](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/reserves/vanitas-stencil), [Fine Regular](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/www.fontsquirrel.com/fonts/COM4t-Fine-Regular) COM4t  
To be customized: [Retro Super Skinny](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/www.subflux.com/Fonts/FontsRecre_Retro.htm) (aka Stark Debonair), [Seaside](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/andrijtype/seaside), [Carisma](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/castletype/carisma), [Euro Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/profonts/euro-sans-pro), [Bodoni Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/www.myfonts.com/search/bodoni+sans), [Vage](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/behaviour/vage), [Domaine Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/www.klim.co.nz/retail-fonts/domaine-sans-display) Display, [Latin counterpart of some foreign languages fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/typophile.com/node/101748), [Darby Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/commercialtype.com/typefaces/darby)

thank you kthomps5

thank you ryuk, yes it is the same one with the [http://typophile.com/node/114140](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317054716/http:/typophile.com/node/114140 "http://typophile.com/node/114140").  
I think the "G" customized from Seaside, and the other words use Vanitas Stencil. what do you think?

Can't state if it has been started with Vanitas but still thinking it is the best out-the-box option, squooshing it a bit, adjusting stencil and recreating /G from /O. I'd be very surprised if finally somebody come and confirm both New York Magazine and Selena Gomez artwork cover are using the same typeface. Maybe designer of SG's album cover took inspiration from New York Magazine.
